TowerDefense

Class Walker

  • java.lang.Object
    • Engine.GameObject
      • TowerDefense.GameObjectPlus
        • TowerDefense.Destructible
          • TowerDefense.Character
            • TowerDefense.Walker
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    WalkerBasic, WalkerQuick

    public abstract class Walker
extends Character
    Walkers are the characters that move along the path. Are they friends? Are they foes? That's for the developers to decide. NOTE: Walkers used to be able to attack things. This functionality has not been used or updated in quite awhile. Most of the functionality regarding attacking has been commented out, and what hasn't won't affect the game. Theoretically, someone could get it working again if they want to.
    Author:
    Branden Drake, Rachel Horton

    • Method Detail

      • setDamageTakenPerSecond

        public static void setDamageTakenPerSecond(float damage)
        Sets the amount of damage all Walkers will take every second. Note that this will override any health being gained per second.
        Parameters:
        damage - The amount of damage to take every second.

      • setHealthGainedPerSecond

        public static void setHealthGainedPerSecond(float health)
        Sets the amount of health all Walkers will gain every second. Note that this will override any damage being taken per second.
        Parameters:
        health - The amount of health to gain per second.

      • getDamageTakenPerSecond

        public static float getDamageTakenPerSecond()
        Note: negative values mean that Walkers are being healed every second.
        Returns:
        The amount of damage Walkers currently take every second.

      • getHealthGainedPerSecond

        public static float getHealthGainedPerSecond()
        Note: negative values mean that Walkers are being damaged every second.
        Returns:
        The amount of health Walkers gain every second.

      • setDefaultSpeed

        public static boolean setDefaultSpeed(float speed)
        Sets the default, unmodified speed of Walkers. The value must be positive. Note that while some Walkers with modified movement speeds may not move at this exact speed, all Walkers will be affected by this change.
        Parameters:
        speed - The speed of an unmodified, basic Walker.
        Returns:
        True if the new speed was applied.

      • getDefaultSpeed

        public static float getDefaultSpeed()
        Returns the unmodified default speed of Walkers. Note that while some Walkers with modified movement speeds may not move at this exact speed, all Walkers will be affected by this change.
        Returns:
        The speed.

      • setTimeUntilDeadDisappear

        public static void setTimeUntilDeadDisappear(float seconds)
        When a Walker dies, it will disappear from the screen after this many seconds. Negative numbers will result in Walkers never disappearing.
        Parameters:
        seconds - How long until dead Walkers disappear.

      • setRepository

        public static void setRepository(SetOfWalkers walkerSet)
        Sets the repository that newly-created Walkers will be added to. The repository is a set of Walkers, and setting the repository allows this list to automatically be updated each time a Walker is created. A null value will result in no automatic repository being used.
        Parameters:
        walkerSet - The storage container for Walkers.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Destructor. Remove this Walker from the game...as much as we can in Java.
        Overrides:
        destroy in class Character

      • applySpeedBuff

        public void applySpeedBuff(float multiplier,
                           float duration)
        Multiplies this Walker's speed by a value for a set duration. Note that this will override any existing speed buffs.
        Parameters:
        multiplier - The value to multiply speed by.
        duration - The number of seconds for the buff to last.
